title: SoftOne Group söker Produktägare inom ekonomi och redovisning
description:
**SoftOne är ett affärssystemföretag på en spännande tillväxtresa. Nu söker SoftOne en produktägare som vill vara med på resan och skapa en än mer konkurrenskraftig produkt som adderar värde för kunderna.** 




  





 Det här är drömjobbet för dig som vill hitta nya utmaningar inom produktutveckling. I ditt arbete på SoftOne blir du unik bland konkurrenterna då SoftOne i dagsläget är en av få leverantörer som inom molnbaserade system har ekonomi, försäljning, lager, inköp, projekt, tid, bemanning, schema och lön integrerat i samma affärsplattform. SoftOne är ett bolag som satsar allt på utveckling och kvalitetsarbete, har snabba beslutsvägar, höga visioner och skapar möjligheter för dig att lyckas, växa och utvecklas.
 



 På SoftOne Group nyttjar vi naturligt våra egna verktyg enligt devisen ”leva som vi lär”. Som medarbetare hos oss förväntas du brinna för att genom digitalisering möjliggöra ökad konkurrenskraft, effektivitet och lönsamhet. Detta är SoftOne:s mission och gäller både internt och som förebild för kunder.
 



  





**Rollen innebär:** 




 Som Produktägare ingår du i SoftOne:s produktteam och ansvarar för att utveckla och effektivisera produkten inom ekonomi och redovisning. Du har örat mot marken, håller dig uppdaterad inom området och har en ”expertisroll” riktad mot intern verksamhet och kunder. Du blir en viktig person i arbetet med att leda SoftOne:s kunder och deras verksamheter till nästa nivå med affärsplattformen SoftOne GO.
 



  





**I arbetsuppgifterna ingår att:** 



* Ha nära kontakt med användare av produkten för att förstå deras behov och hur de ska prioriteras.
* Kontinuerligt definiera produkten, följa upp att produkten möter verksamhetens behov samt att produkten utvecklas i takt med verksamhetens förändrade behov på både kort och lång sikt.
* Tillsammans med ett tvärfunktionellt team ansvara för aktiviteter som ska drivas kopplat till utveckling och förvaltning av produkten.
* Ansvara för att utforma, kravställa och prioritera features inom ditt område som rör nyutveckling, buggar och förbättringar av befintlig lösning. Kravställning består av både beskrivande detaljer kring nuläge och önskat läge samt en designskiss/mockup. SoftOne använder sig av Figma som designstöd.



  




* Tillsammans med övriga produktägare och CPO planera, presentera och realisera uppsatt roadmap. Ansvara för refinement möten med utvecklingsteamet där syftet är att lyfta upp och diskutera ärenden som rör nyutveckling, buggar och förbättringar av befintlig funktionalitet.
* Vid behov, stötta supportavdelningen med att återskapa buggar.
* Vara involverad i regressionstester i samband med release. Du bidrar även till att SoftOne:s test- och leveransprocesser kontinuerligt förfinas. Tester utförs av dedikerad testare i utvecklingsteamet.
* Ansvara för att dokumentation (video och skriftligt) av nyheter finns tillgängligt i samband med release. Du underhåller den integrerade online-servicen och bidrar med produktnära dokumentation exempelvis med artiklar till kunskapsbanken.



  





**Övriga arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Du bidrar till att produktavdelningen fortsätter att utvecklas och effektiviseras baserat på uppsatta mål.
* Du medverkar på möten med produktstyrelse var tredje vecka.
* Du stöttar organisationen med utredningar och önskemål och hjälper till om det uppstår kritiska problem.
* Du hjälper till att svara på frågor från organisationen som kommer via interna veckomöten samt den interna FAQ kanalen.
* Du bidrar till att sprida kunskap för området ekonomi och redovisning till kollegor inom SoftOne.
* Vid behov, deltar du tillsammans med sälj vid införsäljning, t ex i samband med GAP- analys.
* Du medverkar på utvalda governance möten med kund.
* Du håller i interna och externa presentationer, workshops och liknande.



  





 Vi sitter i trevliga lokaler i centrala Stockholm. Produktavdelningen består idag av 10 medarbetare och är uppdelade i fyra olika utvecklingsteam. I teamen finns medarbetare från Sverige, Finland och Sri Lanka. Du rapporterar till CPO.
 



  





 SoftOne jobbar med 3 veckors sprintar och release sker var tredje vecka. SoftOne har en produktstyrelse som träffas var tredje vecka. Styrelsen är ett beslutande forum där syftet är att diskutera större projekt som kommit in och som kan påverka roadmap, eskalera potentiella problem samt besluta vad som ska göras inför nästkommande sprint.
 



  





  





**Vem är du?** 




 Du kanske arbetar med liknande arbetsuppgifter idag men med en annan titel, såsom t ex business analyst eller produktspecialist. Alternativt arbetar som implementationskonsult, konsultchef inom redovisning eller ekonomikonsult och vill gå mot en mer utvecklingsinriktad roll.
 



 För att lyckas i rollen är du självgående, lyhörd och handlingskraftig. Du har projektledaregenskaper och är strukturerad med förmåga att prioritera. Du är inspirerande och affärsmässig med passion för produktutveckling och dess progressiva utveckling. Du har även en analytisk ådra för att kunna fatta datadrivna beslut som hjälper företaget att nå sina mål.
 



 Vi tror att du brinner för digitalisering, har mycket god systemvana och erfarenhet av moderna IT-miljöer. Genom att sätta dig in i användarnas situation så skapar du positiva kundupplevelser med förstklassig service på ett effektivt och strukturerat tillvägagångssätt. Du är utvecklingsinriktad och det kommer naturligt för dig att bidra till förbättringsarbete. Du uppskattar teamarbete likväl som självständigt arbete.
 



  





  





**Vi ser gärna att du har:** 



* Ett par års erfarenhet av att jobba med produktutveckling eller liknande.
* Erfarenhet av kravställning inom området redovisning, inventarier, kund- och leverantörsreskontra, banktransaktioner och tillhörande rapportstruktur.
* Brinnande intresse av att digitalisera och effektivisera systemprocesser.
* Eftergymnasiala studier, akademisk examen eller motsvarande.
* Uttrycker dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska.



  





**Det är extra meriterande:** 



* Om du har erfarenhet av att jobba inom området ”Logistik” (projekt, lager, försäljning och inköp).
* Vana av att arbeta i agila digitala system som Azure Devops eller Jira.
* Om du har erfarenhet av att arbeta med ekonomiprocesser i de nordiska länderna, framför allt i Finland.
* Om du har jobbat med ett SaaS system i ett snabbväxande företag.



  





**SoftOne erbjuder:** 



* En roll i en snabbväxande organisation med möjlighet att påverka och utvecklas. Hos SoftOne har vi korta beslutsvägar men genomtänkta processer. Vi sitter i trevliga lokaler i centrala Stockholm med närhet till kommunikationer.
* Sommartid med 35/h arbetsvecka
* Tjänstepension via Skandia
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring
* Hälsovårdsförsäkring
* Deltagande i vinstandelsstiftelse



  





**Om SoftOne:** 




 SoftOne är ett SaaS-bolag inom ERP och HRM. Vår molnbaserade produkt SoftOne GO är marknadsledande leverantör i Norden för affärs- och HR-system. Vi utvecklar och säljer lösningarna själva och stöttar våra kunder med support, konsulttjänster och outsourcing av lön.
 



  





 Bland våra 2000 kunder återfinns bolag såsom ICA Sverige, Coop och Tele2. SoftOne grundades 1985 och våra cirka 80 anställda arbetar från våra kontor i Stockholm, Söderhamn, Helsingfors och Colombo.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Låter detta intressant? I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Valegro Rekrytering & Interim. Ansvarig Rekryteringskonsult är Erika Klatzkow, erika.klatzkow@valegro.se, tel. 0704-121950. Vänligen klicka på ”Sök denna tjänst” för att snabbt och enkelt skicka in din ansökan. Vi går igenom urvalet löpande så tveka inte att söka redan idag.
 



  





  





*Valegro är ett nischat bolag som rekryterar och hyr ut konsulter inom ekonomi, finans, försäljning och management samt konsulterar i organisationsfrågor.* 




*Med över 20 års erfarenhet av branschen har vi byggt upp ett stort nätverk av kandidater, konsulter och kunder. Vi hjälper även våra kunder i strategiska frågor kring försäljning och ledarskap.* 




*För oss är långsiktighet och förtroende viktigt. I våra uppdrag har vi alltid kunden och kandidatens bästa för våra ögon och vi gör allt för att du som kund och kandidat ska känna dig trygg med vår kompetens, styrka i leverans och att vi har förstått ditt behov. Våra kunder och kandidater värdesätter vårt engagemang och den personliga service vi ger.*

title: Sales Capture Associate Director - H&PS - SW
description:
**Senior Sales Director**
**Accenture Nordic**
**Health and Public Service**
**Base: Sweden**
 Want to make excellent ideas happen for some of the world's most dynamic companies? Join Accenture!
   

  

 Accenture is a global management consulting, technology services and outsourcing company with approximately 750,000 employees. With broad global resources, deep operational, and technical know-how collaborate with clients to nurture ideas and deliver results.
   

  

 We are currently looking for a
 **Senior Sales Director** 
 for the
 **strategic sales** 
 team that is comprised of sales professionals passionate about generating potential opportunities and on contracting work with clients within the
 **Health and Public Service** 
 area in Sweden.
   

  

  

**Job Description**
 Your primary role will be to drive growth by increasing the flow of prospective deals into the Sales Pipeline and leading the qualified opportunities through all deal maturity phases to successful wins.
   

  

**Key responsibilities may include:**
- Identifying potential leads by positioning deep industry-based value propositions using Accenture’s industry insight, assets, references, and campaigns

- Shape differentiated value propositions building on deep industry insight demonstrating Accenture’s broad capability areas including technology operations, DevOps, digitalization, technology transformation, journey to cloud, business process outsourcing, digital marketing operations, data/value led transformation, and strategy advisory services

- Develop strategies and tactics for penetration of new accounts and cross selling to establish accounts

- Initiate and qualify opportunities that are acceptable to Accenture and have a justified business case for the client

- Set and lead pursuit teams from initial client meetings through all phases of the sales and deal cycle

- Maintain a keen sense of marketplace intelligence of trends and competition to provide market leading perspectives, emerging trends, tools, and techniques that can be successfully utilised to develop and promote business

- Track and communicate progress against sales goals and targets

**Qualifications**
- Several years of selling/business development experience; against multiple million-dollar sales targets

- Deep insight and understanding of Health and Public Service

- Ability to meet travel requirements, when applicable

- A relevant master’s degree or equivalent

- Advanced sales and deal orchestration/leadership skills

- Excellent business insight and industry competence

- Shown global expertise and perspective; executive level presence and influence

- Outstanding communication in English (written and oral) and interpersonal skills

- Strong organisational, multi-tasking, time-management, and analytical skills

**Investing in you**
 At Accenture, we believe that quality comes from within, and we invest considerable resources in the development of your professional proficiencies. You will receive ongoing training and leadership development that builds and extends your skills on a continuous basis. The training takes place both in the home office and at our various locations around the world.
   

  

**Balancing your priorities**
 Our employees are our most important asset, and we provide an environment that encourages a healthy work/life balance. You will get your own career counsellor (People Lead) who interacts with you on a regular basis, ensuring you a career path that suits your needs and ambitions. By using laptops, mobile phones, internet access and technological innovation, you will furthermore benefit from our flexible working arrangements.
   

  

 Are you interested in developing your career opportunities in an extraordinary environment? Submit your application and CV online today.
   

  

 Please submit your application in English by clicking the link below. If you have any questions regarding this position or if you want to find out how you can develop your career opportunities at Accenture in general, please contact recruitment; Annette Kleisdorff +45 29999041.

title: Systemutvecklare C++ till Svenska kraftnät
description:
**Annons stänger: 2024-08-15**
 Vill du jobba och utvecklas i en växande organisation och tillsammans med underbara medarbetare och skapa en framåtlutad och robust IT-organisation?
   

  

 Som Systemutvecklare C++ erbjuds du ett av Sveriges viktigast IT jobb, i vilket du varje dag kommer att bidra till Sveriges elförsörjning. De behöver dig för att lyckas med deras samhällsviktiga uppdrag att elektrifiera Sverige, sök dig till Svenska kraftnät!
   

  

 Om tjänsten
   

  

 Du kommer vara del av enheten Analys- och simuleringsapplikationer som idag består av ca 25 medarbetare indelade i flera team som huvudsakligen arbetar med systemutveckling. Enheten ansvarar för utveckling, förvaltning och drift av två verksamhetskritiska applikationer som används för övervakning och analys av kraftsystemet samt för träning och certifiering av kontrollrumspersonal.
   

  

 Fokus för tjänsten kommer att vara kraftsystemsimulatorn ARISTO. Systemet med dess omfattande nätmodell kan sägas utgöra en digital tvilling av kraftsystemet och kan simulera hela det nordiska kraftsystemet i realtid. ARISTO används idag av Svenska kraftnät samt av ett antal externa kunder.
   

  

 Enhetens system utvecklas och driftas i Linux-miljö med höga krav både på tillgänglighet och säkerhet. För att kombinera dessa krav med en hög leveransförmåga så har teamen de senaste åren gjort stora förflyttningar inom DevOps/DevSecOps och detta kommer att vara ett fortsatt fokusområde framåt. Ett annat fokusområde är modernisering av applikationerna och just nu pågår ett projekt för att ersätta äldre delar med modern teknik och arkitektur.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
 Som Systemutvecklare C++ kommer du leverera ny funktionalitet till Svenska kraftnäts interna samt externa användare. Du kommer arbeta med generell utveckling av simulator ARISTO utifrån en prioriterad backlog. ARISTO används huvudsakligen för att träna operatörer.
   

  

 Fokus för nya lösningar kommer vara en mer användarvänlig och lättunderhållen produkt med högre testtäckning. Du bidrar med din kunskap och levererar tillsammans med teamet robusta, användarvänliga och testbara lösningar.
   

  

 Kodbasen för backend består mestadels av C/C++ men även Python-kod förekommer. Versionshantering sker i git och pipeline körs med Azure (on prem). Kod och säkerhetsanalys hanteras av SonarQube och Xray. Bygget sköts av CMake. Conan används för vissa tredjepartsbibliotek. Vi hanterar modelldata (för simulering) i PostgreSQL. Utveckling och produktion sker på RedHat system. Det finns licens för CLion men det står dig fritt att använda ditt favoritverktyg. ARISTO:s frontend migreras från traditionell desktop till JavaScript.
   

  

**Svenska kraftnät erbjuder dig**
 Du ges goda möjligheter till personlig utveckling med mycket erfarna kollegor. På sikt finns det goda möjligheter att rotera internt och testa på nytt inom organisationen. Dessutom erbjuder vi förmånliga semestervillkor, flexibla arbetstider och en mötespolicy som ger goda möjligheter att balansera arbete och privatliv.
   

  

**Om dig**
 Vi söker dig som är bra på att samarbeta samtidigt som du har god förmåga att arbeta självständigt och vara självgående. Vidare behöver du vara resultatorienterad samt ha god problemlösningsförmåga. Rollen är varierande och därför ser vi att du är flexibel och att du har en god förmåga att kunna se helheten för att lättare kunna prioritera bland dina arbetsuppgifter. Eftersom systemen är samhällskritiska är det förstås viktigt att du är kvalitetsmedveten.
   

  

**Skallkrav**
 Vi ser att du har teknisk högskoleexamen inom IT eller motsvarande kompetens förvärvad på annat sätt.
   

  

 Du har även:
   

  

* Aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av systemutveckling varav minst 2 år i C/C++
* Erfarenhet av api:er och backend för web, till exempel REST, Websockets, webbservers
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


 Vi ser det som meriterande om du har erfarenhet av frontend-utveckling i JavaScript.
   

  

 Bra att veta
   

  

* Tjänsten är placerad i Sundbyberg
* Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50 %
* Sista ansökningsdag är 2024-08-15.
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidaretjänst


**Intresserad av att ansöka eller få veta mer?**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Svenska kraftnät med IDG Recruitment. Vid frågor kontakta ansvariga rekryteringskonsult Johanna Nordberg 070-334 31 59, johanna.nordberg@foundryco.com eller Maria Sahlén rekryterare hos Svenska kraftnät 010-489 20 27, maria.sahlen2@svk.se.
   

  

 Fackliga representanter är Annika Ingeborn, SACO, 010 475 87 72 och Mikael Hedenheim, ST, tel. 010-475 84 68. Du når oss också via e-post: fornamn.efternamn@svk.se.
   

  

**Övrig information**
 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) att genomföras i de fall befattningen innebär hantering av säkerhetsskyddsklassificerade uppgifter eller deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet. Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning.
   

  

 För anställning på Svenska kraftnät krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Med anställningen följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras.
   

  

 För mer information om säkerhetsprövning
   

  

 Svenska kraftnät arbetar för att främja mångfald och motverka diskriminering och ser gärna sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter till våra rekryteringar.
   

  

 Lär känna Svenska kraftnät och hur det är att arbeta hos oss:
   

  

 Lär känna oss på Svenska kraftnät

title: Senior Application Engineer
description:
**Senior Application Engineer, Solution Engineering**

 **Location:** Sweden or Denmark - Hybrid, Home Office, or Office based

 **Position Summary:**

  

Bentley Systems seeks a Senior Application Engineer to work in a customer-facing role alongside a team of sales and technical colleagues, they will provide the technical expertise required to win new business and increase usage in existing user organisations. The Senior AE is a trusted advisor and will be responsible for assessing prospect’s business and technical requirements and developing solutions that meet those needs.

  



**Your Day-to-Day:**

  

* Maintain expert level of product knowledge
* Articulate technology and product positioning to both business and technical users
* Perform value and benefit oriented technical presentations of Bentley products and solutions.
* Prepare and deliver both overarching solution demonstrations and bespoke tailored demonstrations for individual prospects or during marketing events.
* Work with the wider sales team to identify and analyse business issues and opportunities
* Assist Business Development and Sales personnel in technical proposal development for prospects and existing customers
* Provide your experience and knowledge of user requirements to help product management to design and develop new products and services
* Develop standard demonstration sets and content for selected products
* Knowledge transfer to partners and strengthen Bentley ecosystem
* This is a full-time role, based at home, in a Bentley office or a hybrid to suit your preference
* Travel within Nordics and EU up to 25% of the time on average

 **What You Bring To The Team:**

  

* Full professional proficiency in Swedish and English language is required, Danish also desirable
* 5+ years of experience in managing ProjectWise, BCDE, iTwins or similar system is required
* Presentation skills and public speaking experience is desirable
* Comprehensive understanding of electronic document management with strong emphasis on engineering design
* Familiarity with relational databases, including administration, operation and maintenance with Microsoft SQL Server
* Excellent writing skills are a must, as s/he will be responsible for writing white papers and communicating product details and applications to the public
* Ability to communicate value and benefit propositions to audiences of all levels of knowledge and seniority
* BIM digital workflow experience

 **What We Offer:**

  

* A great Team and culture – please see our Recruitment Video.
* An exciting career as an integral part of a world-leading software company providing solutions for architecture, engineering, and construction.
* Competitive Salary and benefits.
* The opportunity to work within a global and diverse international team.
* A supportive and collaborative environment.
* Colleague Recognition Awards.

 **Who We Are:**

  

Bentley Systems (Nasdaq: BSY) is the infrastructure engineering software company. We provide innovative software to advance the world’s infrastructure – sustaining both the global economy and environment. Our industry-leading software solutions are used by professionals, and organizations of every size, for the design, construction, and operations of roads and bridges, rail and transit, water and wastewater, public works and utilities, buildings and campuses, mining, and industrial facilities. Our offerings, powered by the iTwin Platform for infrastructure digital twins, include MicroStation and Bentley Open applications for modeling and simulation, Seequent’s software for geoprofessionals, and Bentley Infrastructure Cloud encompassing ProjectWise for project delivery, SYNCHRO for construction management, and AssetWise for asset operations. Bentley Systems’ 5,200 colleagues generate annual revenues of more than $1 billion in 194 countries.

 **Equal Opportunity Employer:**

  

Bentley is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers for employment all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, gender/gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, marital status, religion/belief, national origin, caste, age, or any other characteristic protected by local law or unrelated to job qualifications.

title: Senior Product Manager, Grafana Sharing (Remote, Sweden)
description:
**This is a remote position and we're considering candidates in Sweden only.**



As a Product Manager at Grafana Labs, you'll develop a vision and strategy for your product domain. You will own your product’s roadmap, collateral, and market research, and you will collaborate with Grafana leadership on fine-tuning your product’s goals. You will be the primary advocate and expert in your area, with a strong ability to communicate needs, functionality, and details effectively both to external customers and internal stakeholders. The teams and people you will be interacting with will be 100% remote and globally distributed, so strong and proactive communication is essential.



Product Managers are the bridge that connect Engineering, Design, and Product Design to Go-To-Market. You are a facilitator who ensures the free flow of information across these teams and are expected to be technically proficient when representing our products to our customers.


**The Domain**



You will be the product manager for the Sharing teams at Grafana Labs, which are building essential features at the core of our users’ key workflows for both external and internal adoption.



You will improve Grafana’s sharing and export capabilities to help users collaborate and get their Grafana content to their audience. This includes everything from embedding visualizations in other applications to creating reports for executives. You will also help users share queries internally across an organization by creating a query library to help users reuse the often-complex queries involved in data exploration and troubleshooting. Lastly, you’ll improve tools like Correlations that help users link from one kind of data to another, which is essential for exploring complex infrastructure and different kinds of telemetry.



The engineering teams you’ll work with are relatively new, and there is tremendous opportunity to improve users’ querying and sharing experiences. You’ll develop deep fluency with customer needs in this space, as well as the existing landscape of open-source and commercial solutions. You’ll define a vision for the future, designing new sharing integrations or intuitive query workflows that help users resolve issues faster. You will be responsible for integrating this vision into our customers’ observability journey, driving widespread adoption, and contributing to the overall growth of Grafana.


**As a Product Manager at Grafana Labs, you will:**


* Transform ideas and feedback into a product vision and roadmap
* Empathize with customer problems in order to collect user needs, requirements, and pain points
* Curate and properly represent user feedback to Engineering, while providing evidence to support tradeoffs and priorities
* Work closely with Product Marketing to explain our tracing platform’s unique differentiation to Go-To-Market teams, creating documentation, blog posts, website content, datasheets, and whitepapers.
* Use your deep product expertise to make decisions about our go-to-market strategies, pricing, packaging, licensing, and tiering.


**We’re excited about you because you have:**


* 2+ years of experience in Product Management
* Experience shipping B2B SaaS software to customers
* A desire to dive into complex solutions and work with a highly technical product and customers
* Experience partnering with Product Design to build delightful user experiences
* Experience working with engineering teams to design and build products in a fast-paced environment
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills


**Bonus Points**


* Experience with Growth product management: measurement, experimentation, and multivariate testing
* Experience operating or using Grafana Labs open source projects or products
* Experience with open source software and/or commercial open source companies
* Experience with products offered both via SaaS and self-managed


In Sweden, the Base compensation range for this role is SEK 738,518 - SEK 886,222 Actual compensation may vary based on level, experience, and skillset as assessed in the interview process. Benefits include equity, bonus (if applicable) and other benefits listed here.


* *Compensation ranges are country-specific. If you are applying for this role from a different location than listed above, your recruiter will discuss your specific market’s defined pay range & benefits at the beginning of the process.*

  

**About Grafana Labs:** There are more than 20M users of Grafana, the open source visualization tool, around the globe, monitoring everything from beehives to climate change in the Alps. The instantly recognizable dashboards have been spotted everywhere from a NASA launch and Minecraft HQ to Wimbledon and the Tour de France. Grafana Labs also helps more than 3,000 companies - including Bloomberg, JPMorgan Chase, and eBay - manage their observability strategies with the Grafana LGTM Stack, which can be run fully managed with Grafana Cloud or self-managed with the Grafana Enterprise Stack, both featuring scalable metrics (Grafana Mimir), logs (Grafana Loki), and traces (Grafana Tempo).

**Benefits:** For more information about the perks and benefits of working at Grafana, please check out our careers page.

**Equal Opportunity Employer:** At Grafana Labs we’re building a company where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, stay, and do their best work. We know that our company runs on the hard work and the dedication of our passionate and creative employees. If you're excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways.

We will recruit, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status, and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and unique. We believe that equality and diversity builds a strong organization and we’re working hard to make sure that’s the foundation of our organization as we grow.

*For information about how your personal data is used once you’ve applied to a job, check out our* *privacy policy**.*
company_description: Grafana Labs is the company behind Grafana, the leading open source software for visualizing time series data.

title: Systemingenjör
description:
Till vår kund i Jönköpingsregionen söker vi just nu efter en systemingenjör.
  
Kundens verksamhet växer och med detta behöver dom förstärka med nya medarbetare som skall arbeta med systemkrav och design av digitala tjänster.
  
Arbetsuppgifterna
  
* Du definierar och dokumenterar hur funktionalitet som berör uppkopplade produkter och digitala tjänster skall fungera.
* Du samarbetar med andra systemingenjörer i utveckling av produkterna som dom digitala tjänsterna övervakar och styr.
* Arbetet sker i tekniska utredningar, insamling av information och utifrån detta dra slutsatser tillsammans med andra ingenjörer, arkitekter, testare, m.fl.


Kravprofil
  
* Du har en högskoleexamen på teknisk nivå.
* Pratar och skriver engelska obehindrat. Svenska är ett plus.
* Erfarenhet från systemingenjörs-arbete eller kravhantering för digitala tjänster är ett plus
* IoT och mjukvaruutveckling i cloud-miljö är ett plus.
* Kan arbeta på plats i Jönköpingsregionen.


Egenskaper för att lyckas
  
* Du är målorienterad, analytisk och kommunikativ.
* Öppen för och intresserad av att jobba med nya tekniker
* Förståelse för kundens behov och hur man kan uppfylla dessa.


Startdatum – 2024-09-01
  
  

Intresserad? Kontakt oss på jobb@skarpr.se med ditt CV eller LinkedIn profil.
  
**Kort om oss:** Skarp Rekrytering är ett företag med som erbjuder kvalificerad rekrytering inom främst tjänstemannasektorn. Grundaren av bolaget har arbetat i åtta år med både större, mindre och mellanstora kunder i och hjälpt att matcha rätt person till rätt uppdrag. Det som kännetecknar oss är en vilja att hjälpa till i kombination med en transparent dialog kring förväntningar. Bolaget har sitt huvudsäte i Linköping men arbetar nationellt inom Sverige.
  
Välkommen att läsa mer på www.skarpr.se

title: Group Financial Controller
description:
**Start****ASAP****Duration****7-9 months**
  
Emagine are now looking for a Group Financial Controller to one of our amazing banking clients.  

  

**Start:** ASAP  

**End:** 2025-02-12  

**Location:** Stockholm (3days on site, 2 days remote)

 **About the assignment:**  

This is an interim position while recruiting for a replacement for a Group financial controller. The consultant will be responsible for the whole Life group monthly reporting to Group according to IFRS. The consultant will also be holding up the position of the superuser in the consolidation and reporting system; FCCS (Orcle EPM cloud solution), implemented in 2022 in the Life Group and in 2024 in the Group.  

  

**What we are looking for:**  

We are looking for a consultant with extensive experience in group accounting and group reporting of groups. We are looking for someone who has served as a group controller at the top level of a corporation. This experience is entirely different from simply working with group reporting, which many have done. We implemented Oracle EPM cloud solution FCCS for 2 years ago. You will be solely responsible for clients Livgruppen's consolidated group reporting to Group. You will also take on the role of super-user of our group reporting system.  

  

**What the consultant will be working on:**  

* Responsible for group reporting to the clients Group in collaboration with the rest of the team
* Analyze and ensure the quality of the group reporting
* Document existing processes and routines
* Participate in project activities related to clients implementation from a Life perspective
* Participate in further developing system support and processes

  

**Requirements**:  

* Oracle EPM and its consolidation system FCCS. Experience with this system or with HFM, which is the underlying system solution for the cloud-based FCCS, is advantageous.
* Experience in group accounting
* Has previously served as a -user and enjoys sharing knowledge with others
* Reporting according to IFRS standards
* Previous experience in accounting and reporting for insurance or banking
* Experience in group reporting within a large organization with various reporting requirements
* It is very important that you have a strong interest in group reporting systems and that you have the ability and interest to learn a new system
* Knowledge of acquisition eliminations
* Internal reconciliation issues and handling large transactions with many discrepancies
* Group reporting systems and their functionality
* The consolidation process and its management
* Communication with subsidiaries
* Review of the figures reported by subsidiaries
* It is very important that you are a self-motivated person who can solve problems.

  

**Language**:  

Swedish and English
  
Endi Dedic

title: Data Platform Architect
description:
An exciting opportunity to work in an innovative family-owned company that operates globally within several different business areas.About UsWe are seeking a passionate and dynamic Data Platform Architect to join our innovative IT team. This is your chance to shape the future of our data platform architecture, ensuring it meets our organization's needs for scalability, performance, and security.What You'll DoIn this role, you will lead the design, implementation, and maintenance of our data platform architecture. You will develop and define the technical strategy and roadmap for the platform, working closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, engineers, and business stakeholders, to ensure it meets the evolving needs of our organization. You will also establish data governance policies to ensure quality and proper usage across the platform. Additionally, you will develop and maintain data models and metadata, providing technical guidance and mentorship to team members.Who You AreWe are looking for someone with a strong background in data integration technologies, data warehouses, and big data platforms. You should have deep expertise in data architecture, design, and implementation, and the ability to define data pipelines to ensure efficient data collection, processing, and storage. Proficiency in cloud computing technologies, especially AWS or Azure, is essential. You should hold a Bachelor's degree in computer science, data science, or a related field, and have demonstrated experience as a Data Platform Architect or in a similar role. Excellent communication skills in English, both spoken and written, are required, and knowledge of Swedish is a plus.Why You'll Love Working With UsYou will be part of a forward-thinking team where your contributions will make a significant impact. You will work on exciting projects that challenge your skills and creativity, with ample opportunities for continuous learning and professional development. We value mentorship and adaptability, and we are looking for someone who is excited about the future of data and eager to stay ahead of industry trends.
  
Ready to take the next step in your career? Apply now and help us drive innovation with data!About usAt Stena Group IT we have a unique position where we deliver to all business units across Stena AB. This means we are at the intersection of delivering business technology to harness renewable energy, create smart buildings, pilot cognitive ferries, and much more. We are seeking people that are ambitious, have a sense of purpose and appreciate technology’s potential – and are passionate to turn its promise into reality!
  
At the Stena HQ office in Danmarksterminalen you will meet, collaborate, and have fun with your colleagues, but working remotely is also a part of the Stena way of working if you prefer. We are committed to maintaining and developing a sustainable working environment, that gives equal opportunities to everyone. We embrace equality, diversity, and inclusion – and welcome all applicants.
  
**Read more about STENA Group IT:** Not just a global Shipping companyContactsAbout the position – Saurabh Pranami, Head of Architecture & Technology, saurabh.pranami@stena.comAbout the recruitment process - Richard Svarre, HR Business Partner, richard.svarre@stena.com
  
If you are a highly skilled Data Platform Architect, we encourage you to apply today, but no later than August 31.

title: Solution Consultant – Tietoevry Tech Services
description:
Are you a curious and engaged IA Consultant looking to join one of the largest tech companies in the Nordics? Then this is the role for you!
  
We are looking for a passionate technical expert with extensive experience in Intelligent Automation, who wants to be part of Tietoevry Tech Services.
  
  

When joining Tietoevry Tech Services as a Solution Consultant in IA, you will:
  
Lead Intelligent Automation initiatives in Sweden
  
Engage extensively with customers to identify and implement IA solutions
  
Increase awareness and ramp-up IA competence in Sweden
  
Collaborate with cross-functional teams for complex automation projects
  
Focus on expanding IA business in Retail, D365, and SMB segments
  
  

**Who we are looking for:**  

Extensive experience in Intelligent Automation technologies like Process Mining and RPA
  
Strong technical background with significant experience in software development and Intelligent Automation
  
Proven leadership and consulting skills
  
Excellent communication abilities for engaging with IT and business stakeholders
  
  

We offer
  
We offer you professional growth, meaningful projects, open culture, and an outstanding work-life balance! We offer you an opportunity to create the future of a growing, fast-developing, and important sector. We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working. Finally, we also believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle where you need to unlearn and relearn every day as new possibilities emerge.
  
  

Did we get you inspired?
  
We look forward to your application! Please attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile and we will reach out to you. Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact hiring manager Mika Lehtola, mika.lehtola@tietoevry.com.
  
Hope to hear from you soon!
  
  

We perform background checks on all final candidates.
  
Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.
  
Tietoevry thrives with diversity, and we welcome applicants of all genders, ages, abilities, ethnicities, orientations, beliefs, and backgrounds.
  
  

About Tietoevry
  
Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust, and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
  
  

Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprises and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs.
  
  

Creating purposeful technology to reinvent the world for good

title: Executive Assistant, AWS Benelux/Nordics
description:
* Experience assisting at the executive level
* Experience with reconciling expenses
* Substantial experience assisting at the executive level in a fast-paced environment.
* Highly proficient with Microsoft Office, specifically Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint
* Experience with domestic and international travel coordination


Amazon Web Services (AWS) Europe North (Benelux/Nordics) is seeking a proactive, customer obsessed and team oriented Executive Assistant to support the Director of AWS Benelux/Nordics.
  
This role requires attention to detail, organizational skills, and the ability to meet tight deadlines. The candidate will be comfortable in a fast-paced, fluid environment, while maintaining great flexibility, a sense of humor and composure. The candidate will work autonomously on many projects as required and possess the ability to complete a high volume of tasks with minimal guidance or supervision.
  
Amazon EAs are the primary point of contact and information flow to and from a variety of teams, customers and partners to our senior leaders - we seek to hire and then offer continual development to the very best EAs ready to work in our fast paced, customer focused organization.
  
We are looking for bright and motivated candidates with experience of supporting multiple executives and who can demonstrate expertise with complex diary management, travel arrangements and expense recording as well as the set-up, budgeting and active management of small to mid-scale events for their teams.
  
Superior attention to detail and the ability to meet tight deadlines and juggle multiple requests is critical. Integrity and discretion in handling confidential information and professionalism in dealing with senior executives is imperative. A flexible approach is a must, and the ability to change direction at a moment’s notice.
  
As a community, the EAs work together to deliver large scale events and to share workload when priorities demand additional support - commitment to teamwork is essential.
  
Come build the future with us!
  
  

Note, we are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations: Amsterdam or Stockholm.
  
  

Sales, Marketing and Global Services (SMGS)
  
AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
  
  

About the team
  
  

Diverse Experiences
  
AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
  
Why AWS?
  
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
  
Inclusive Team Culture
  
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
  
Mentorship & Career Growth
  
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
  
Work/Life Balance
  
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
  
  

* Senior experience assisting at the executive level
* Ability to quickly learn organizational structures, team objectives and adopt Amazon values and vision
* Ability to handle administrative details independently while exercising good judgment in keeping team members adequately informed
* Creative approach to problem solving and event planning
* Ability to handle confidential information with discretion, and deal with professionals inside and outside the company
* Ability to work in a highly ambiguous and changing environment with composure


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

title: Senior Cloud Engineer
description:
**This is Worldline** 




  





 Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.
 



  





  





**The Opportunity** 




  





 We are seeking a versatile Software Engineer to join our platform team, and work in a constantly evolving, dynamic, and agile environment, believing that the route to speed and stability is through automation. Teamwork, communication, and speaking your mind are of high importance to us, especially when they come with a curious mind, a willingness to grow, and exchange ideas and knowledge.
 



  





 In this role, along with a team of 8 members, you’ll set up AWS (Amazon Web Services) infrastructure which is handling millions of transactions worth billions of Euros. The team has a DevSecOps standpoint, owns, develops, and manages all Infrastructure as Code in AWS accounts, running 100s of containers and serverless functions; If you build it, you run it!
 



  





 If this looks exciting and you are eager to continue growing your professional capabilities with ongoing training and educational opportunities, come join us!
 



  





  





**Day-to-Day Responsibilities​** 




  




* Delivering the committed objectives that include adapting to any new needs to reach the goal
* On-call duty according to a rotating schedule
* Participate in your team's day-to-day activities including tools development, operations, maintenance, and support
* Being an active member in our agile events like daily stand-ups, planning, retros, and demos. etc.
* Foster team spirit, quality and technical agility



  





  





**Who Are We Looking For** 




  





 We look for big thinkers. People who can drive positive change, step up and show what’s next – people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. In practice this means:
 



  




* You have proven experience in systems engineering, automating infrastructure creation & maintenance tasks using Docker, Jenkins, Terraform\ CloudFormation, etc.
* You have a bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, distributed systems, software engineering, or another equivalent field
* You have previous experience in supporting/operating transaction driven and highly available platforms running microservices with 99.99% uptime
* You have a curiosity about security solutions such as WAF, IDS/IPS, Anti-DDOS, and SIEM
* You have work experience in programming (Python scripting) and an interest in automation
* You are passionate about cloud services, pay attention to details, handle many different partners and you are accountable to deliver results in a fast-paced environment



  





  





**Perks & Benefits** 




  





 At Worldline you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:
 



  




* Being a part of a company guided by a strong purpose to do good and recognized as top 1% of the most sustainable companies in all sectors worldwide
* Health benefits contribution
* Health check – Every 2nd year
* Pension: BTP1 & BTP2
* Private Health Care Insurance (Euro Accident)
* Parental pay and 12 months pension during parental leave
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard
* Benefit portal with many great offers, plus more.



  





  





**Shape the evolution** 




  





 We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries, and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.
 



  





**Learn more about life at Worldline at
 
 jobs.worldline.com**




  





**We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.**

title: Cloud Security Engineer
description:
We are looking for a Cloud Security Engineer that will join the Cloud Security team. If automating security infrastructure at large scale, developing secure cloud identity and access management solutions, making least privilege automation easier, embedding security controls & policies as code, providing support and security expertise to others excites you, you might want to consider joining us!
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* You will be part of an agile team, constantly improving and automating the security posture of the cloud infrastructure at Spotify.
* You will partner with and support the Spotify engineering community to build secure infrastructure at scale.
* You will design and develop secure IAM solutions adhering to the principle of least privilege.
* You will build and operate reliable tooling to increase the visibility of cloud environments and remediate security misconfigurations.
* You will be a valued member of the team, providing sound perspectives on infrastructure security as well as software development.
* You will be part of the Spotify Security R&D organization, with a lot of room to grow and develop your skills, knowledge and experience.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have good infrastructure security experience and are passionate about reducing risks in the cloud identity and access management space.
* You have experience with threat modeling, security design reviews, and security architecture.
* You have 3+ years of proven experience working with security in at least one public cloud platform, preferably GCP.
* You have development experience and can write reliable software in Python and/or Java.
* Experience with CI/CD practices, Kubernetes and infrastructure-as-a-code is a plus.
* You have experience from working in agile environments and value working on the team where you constantly learn, experiment, share your knowledge and iterate quickly.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* You'll be based in Stockholm, Sweden or London, UK.


 #Security Engineer - Cloud Infrastructure
   

  

 #Security Engineer - Platform Security

title: FP&A Manager, EMEA
description:
Sinch is a Customer Communication Cloud company, directly powering meaningful conversations at scale across messaging, voice and email to help businesses deliver unified, personalized experiences that truly revolve around their customers - no matter the channels they use. More than 150,000 businesses - including many of the world's largest tech companies, rely on us for their customer communication needs.
   

  

 We dream big - for our company, our customers and our employees - and we hire the best talent worldwide to help us bring our vision to life. We have near 4,500 Sinchers in more than 60 countries - probably somewhere near you!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a FP&A Manager, EMEA, you will support and challenge managers and their organizations to achieve financial goals, offer strategic insights and lead reporting and budgeting process. You will support Revenue growth, OPEX control and cost optimization through proactive business follow-up.
   

  

 This role is based at our HQ in Stockholm, Sweden but we are open to other major Sinch European locations as well. The role reports to VP, EMEA FP&A.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Partner with Regional senior leadership to drive achievement of financial and operational targets
* Drive full P&L development for the Enterprise or Mid-Market Sales organization
* Provide insight and recommendations to strategic decision making; including but not limited to profitability/ROI analysis, business plan review, cost optimization
* Setup frameworks from a finance perspective to enable commercial success; including but not limited to Sales KPI steering and cost allocation models
* Drive process towards creating a full regional P&L including allocated cost
* Build and manage Regional Business reporting packages, including but not limited to P&L, BS and CF-reporting. Measure, report and challenge business performance.
* In accordance with process guidance from Corporate Control lead budgeting, forecasting and long-range planning processes for the Functions
* Interface with central Financial Operations to ensure accurate and timely reporting
* Support Sinch-wide Finance harmonization initiatives (e.g. ERP implementation)


**About You**
 To be successful in the role you have visionary and strategic mindset yet with strong hands-on ability, willingness to deep dive into details when required. You are a strong communicator that is clear, concise, engaging and persuasive across stakeholder groups, adapting the content & language to the audience. You have a commercial and business focused approach and are able to structure and process qualitative or quantitative data and draw conclusions. Last but not least, you love Excel and is fierce at PowerPoint and have the ability to simplify complex data.
   

  

* Proven experience of Business Controlling or equivalent in a large and international company
* Experience of Accounting or Financial control
* Proven experience from driving financial process transformation and process excellence
* Experience in setting up frameworks for commercial enablement (customer pricing, product costing, market research, etc) and supporting contract negotiations etc.
* Experience in the following systems is a plus: Aaro, Tableau, Salesforce, SAP by Design, Great Plains, Netsuite
* Fluency in English is required


**Our Values**
 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple" and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation for fostering an environment where diversity of thinking, skills and experiences are embraced, delivering innovation and better business results.
   

  

**Bring your authentic self to Sinch**
 Here at Sinch we embrace diversity and work to create an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive. No matter who you are, you'll be able to explore new career and growth options - sharing your voice, building your path and making it happen with us.
   

  

 We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will be considered to join our team regardless of race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.
   

  

**Our Hiring Process**
 At Sinch, we are committed to following a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and non-discriminatory. We use pre-employment assessment to create an inclusive application experience to help foster diverse and high performing teams.
   

  

 Even if you do not meet all job requirements, don't let that stop you from considering Sinch for the next step in your career. We are always looking for people that could help us pioneer the way the world communicates.
   

  

 If this role isn't what you're looking for, please consider other open roles on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/

title: Senior Integration / BTP architect
description:
Primary Responsibilities:
 



 o Design, develop, and implement SAP Cloud Integration solutions for integrating SAP and Non-SAP Applications.
 



 o Lead the design of Interfaces and ensure their seamless integration with various systems.
 



 o Provide technical leadership and guidance to the integration team.
 



 o Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into technical design.
 



 o Ensure the successful integration of SAP S4HANA with other systems in a complex, heterogenous and challenging technology environment
 



  
 



 · Additional Responsibilities:
 



 o Leverage SAP Integration technologies like IDoc, SOAP EDI, and AIF for effective integration.
 



 o Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in SAP Cloud Integration.
 



 o Troubleshoot and resolve any issues that arise in the SAP Cloud Integration environment.
 



 o Maintain the SAP BTP Environment and Integration Guardrails in the customer environment
 



  
 



 · Requirements:
 



 o Several years of experience in SAP Cloud Integration.
 



 o Deep understanding of the SAP Integration Suite and its capabilities.
 



 o Must be able to work independently
 



 o Expertise in API development and management.
 



 o Proven experience in integrating SAP and Non-SAP Applications.
 



 o Experience or knowledge of SAP S4HANA integrations.
 



 o Experience with SAP Integration technologies like IDoc and SOAP EDI and AIF.
 



 o Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work under pressure.
 



  
 



 · Desirable:
 



 o SAP Cloud Integration certification would be a plus.
 



 o Experience with integrating other SAP Cloud Services is an added bonus.
 



 o Experience with integrating non-SAP middlewares like Apache Kafka and WSO2 API Manager is an added bonus

title: Product Specialist
description:
**Why join Bannerflow?**
 Bannerflow is a hyper-growth company and one of Europe's most exciting SaaS companies. Our Creative Management Platform serves more than 6 billion ads each month, viewed on 500 million unique devices all over the world. This breaks down to a massive >25 000 requests and almost 2GB of data transfer - per second, on average, constantly! We allow enterprise brands to create, publish, analyze and optimize rich media ads in-house at scale. Our mission is to become the most user-friendly platform for creative automation and campaign management - across channels.To be able to deliver this, we have to stay in the front line of technical development and always keep up with the latest tools and technologies.
   

  

 We advocate and work along with an agile architecture without hierarchy and bureaucracy where we work in small autonomous and cross-functional feature teams. We are a Creative Management Platform that allows companies to focus on being creative rather than spending precious time on repetitive tasks and changing the game by removing the mystery of digital marketing. We simplify complexity, challenge the status quo and as a result, we have the happiest customers in the world.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Product Specialist, you work cross-functionally with customers and prospects to ensure excellent product delivery, high adoption and commercial success throughout the customer lifecycle.
   

  

 Product Specialists have both broad and deep knowledge about the Bannerflow platform, the pains it solves, and the value the customer gets. The role acts as a trusted advisor within the digital advertising landscape by guiding customers to success by showcasing our platform, recommending best practices in ways of working, and leading customers in technical projects.
   

  

**Daily Tasks And Responsibilities Include**
* Master and demonstrate how the Bannerflow platform works, what value it generates and the pains it solves different personas and industries.
* Master in-depth product training sessions with existing customers and conduct value driven sales demos for prospective customers.
* Have the curiosity to over time get an in depth understanding of the Bannerflow go-to-market execution, market dynamics, product vision, and our Must Win Battles (company strategy) that support the company growth.
* Lead customer - initiated projects together with Customer Success Managers and Account Executives who primarily own the customer relationship.
* Assist with customer ad-hoc troubleshooting sessions and solve complex software issues.
* Guide customers through a perfect account setup and best practices for customers network integrations.
* The role requires a high - level understanding of the network destination (DSP).
* Contribute to product development of our platform by sharing customer insights and feedback with Product and Tech.
* Identify improvement areas for internal processes and drive initiatives related to this.


**Who are you?**
 To enjoy working at Bannerflow you should be eager to learn new things and happy to take on challenges. To succeed at Bannerflow in general you need to be passionate and have a black belt in collaboration. As the Bannerflow team is constantly growing, it’s important that you embrace change and thrive in an environment where the landscape is always evolving.
   

  

**Skills**
 We are looking for someone with skills in these areas (you might be an expert on all of these or just a few):
   

  

* Solution-oriented and creative mindset.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills. A listener as well as a presenter with ability to adapt communication to different personas and use industry specific terminology.
* Driven and structured problem solver.
* Previous experience from SaaS or B2B.
* An eye for design and experience from working with tools like Photoshop and Illustrator.
* Familiar with JSON and XML feeds.
* Knowledge about JavaScript, CSS and HTML.
* Experience and good understanding of digital marketing.
* Availability and flexibility to travel if needed.
* Fluent in English. It is a big bonus if you're fluent in Swedish or another language, but it's not a requirement.


**Why join us?**
 We live alongside our values of Passion, Collaboration and Challenge; with many events going on at Bannerflow such as Friday beer, team activities, kick-ass inspiration webinars, health month, values week and level-up hackathons, there’s something for everyone. As a member of the Bannerflow crew, you will get the opportunity to work with a creative, enabling, and highly advanced product within a 100% cloud-based architecture. We take leadership very seriously and our leaders get extensive leadership training in order for you to get the best possible coaching and guidance in your role. Of course we offer a hybrid workplace, furthermore we offer a compensation package including pension according to ITP1, health care insurance and health allowance.
   

  

 We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team and welcome applications from candidates of all backgrounds, experiences, and abilities.
   

  

 Please note that the recruitment process will slow down during the summer months. We appreciate your patience during this period and will get back to you as soon as we are all well rested and ready for fall!

title: Vice President Of Product Management, Trilogy (Remote) - $400,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 Are you at the pinnacle of your career, with a decade of experience steering B2B SaaS products toward market success? Are you interested in working at the cutting edge of generative AI, pioneering its application in product development?
   

  

 Trilogy's portfolio includes over 100 B2B software companies and acquires more every year. In our view, every industry will be disrupted by Generative AI, and all of our products must embrace it. In this role, you will be responsible for setting the GenAI product vision for our entire portfolio of companies. In so doing, you will delve into the customer mindset, involving deep analysis of market trends, customer behavior, and product profitability, and determine how we can leverage GenAI to maximize customer value. Your strategic decisions will significantly influence our products' market positioning and profitability, driving both customer satisfaction and business success.
   

  

 We're not just looking for a product manager; we're looking for a visionary who’s ready to redefine the standards of product management. If you’re ready for a role where you'll drive real market impact, we invite you to bring your expertise to our team!
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Align customer and market analysis with strategic objectives, using generative AI to enhance decision-making and efficiency.
* Perform in-depth analysis of product costs, pricing, and customer data to optimize profitability and market positioning.
* Develop and refine our product offerings, incorporating customer feedback and using AI to create exceptional customer experiences.


**What You Won’t Be Doing**
* Managing the entire product development cycle; your focus will be on high-level strategic planning and decision-making.
* Technical product decisions; these are managed by a specialized team, allowing you to concentrate on the commercial aspects.
* Engaging in constant cross-functional communication; you are the primary decision-making authority.


**Vice President Of Product Management Key Responsibilities**
* Driving customer retention through strategic service offerings, informed by generative AI to maximize value creation.


**Basic Requirements**
* At least 7 years of experience in a product management role within a B2B SaaS company
* Experience leveraging AI technologies (such as ChatGPT, Claude, or Gemini) in a product management context (for ideation, strategy formulation, etc.)


**About Trilogy**
 Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with Crossover**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $200 USD/hour, which equates to $400,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

**What to expect next:**
* You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
* Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


**Important!** 
 If you do not receive an email from us:
   

  

* First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
* Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
* Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
* If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.
