title: AI/ML Engineer
description:
**Description:**
 The consultant will be responsible for investigating and evaluating different methods of integrating generative language models into software products. This includes exploring both on-device deployment on Windows and iOS platforms, as well as cloud-based
   

  

 solutions.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 Investigate On-Device Deployment:
   

  

 • Identify candidate generative language models suitable for on-device deployment on Windows and iOS.
   

  

 • Evaluate the performance and compatibility of these models with the target hardware.
   

  

 Optimize and Test Models:
   

  

 • Identify and evaluate techniques for optimizing on-device performance, such as quantization, pruning, knowledge distillation.
   

  

 • Conduct thorough performance testing on target platforms, including iPadOS and Windows.
   

  

 • Benchmark key metrics such as resource consumption, speed, and power usage by creating reproducible performance testing setups and methodologies.
   

  

 • Fine-tune selected models to support specific use cases.
   

  

           
   

  

 Evaluate Cloud-Based Models:
   

  

 • Assess the feasibility and performance of cloud-based generative language models for integration with our software.
   

  

 • Benchmark quality and performance by identifying and measuring key metrics, including inference latency, throughput, and scalability.
   

  

            
   

  

 Financial and Compliance Analysis:
   

  

 • Analyze the financial impact of using different cloud-based models, considering subscription fees, data storage costs, and usage fees.
   

  

 • Investigate privacy and compliance concerns, ensuring adherence to GDPR and other relevant regulations.
   

  

             
   

  

 Develop Recommendations:
   

  

 • Provide detailed recommendations for both on-device and cloud-based model integration.
   

  

 • Outline potential next steps, including further optimization, extensive testing, or production integration.
   

  

 • Suggest long-term strategies for maintaining and improving deployed models.
   

  

**Skills and Qualifications**
 • Demonstrated skills in machine learning and generative AI.
   

  

 • Expertise in deploying and testing AI models on both Windows and iOS platforms.
   

  

 • Strong skills in performance evaluation and optimization of AI models.
   

  

 • Familiarity with cloud-based AI solutions and their integration.
   

  

 • Understanding of privacy and security issues, especially GDPR compliance.
   

  

 • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
   

  

 • Strong communication skills for documenting processes and providing clear recommendations.
   

  

**Job Title:** 
 AI/ML Engineer
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Job Type:** 
 Contract
   

  

 Trading as TEKsystems. Aston Carter International Ltd UK Filial. Drottninggatan 27,111 51 Stockholm, Sweden. No. 516404-0163. TEKsystems is a company within the Allegis Group network of companies (collectively referred to as "Allegis Group"). Aerotek, Aston Carter, EASi, Talentis Solutions, TEKsystems, Stamford Consultants and The Stamford Group are Allegis Group brands. If you apply, your personal data will be processed as described in the Allegis Group Online Privacy Notice available at https://www.allegisgroup.com/en-gb/privacy-notices.
   

  

 To access our Online Privacy Notice, which explains what information we may collect, use, share, and store about you, and describes your rights and choices about this, please go to https://www.allegisgroup.com/en-gb/privacy-notices.
   

  

 We are part of a global network of companies and as a result, the personal data you provide will be shared within Allegis Group and transferred and processed outside the UK, Switzerland and European Economic Area subject to the protections described in the Allegis Group Online Privacy Notice. We store personal data in the UK, EEA, Switzerland and the USA. If you would like to exercise your privacy rights, please visit the "Contacting Us" section of our Online Privacy Notice at https://www.allegisgroup.com/en-gb/privacy-notices for details on how to contact us. To protect your privacy and security, we may take steps to verify your identity, such as a password and user ID if there is an account associated with your request, or identifying information such as your address or date of birth, before proceeding with your request. If you are resident in the UK, EEA or Switzerland, we will process any access request you make in accordance with our commitments under the UK Data Protection Act, EU-U.S. Privacy Shield or the Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield.

title: Customer Renewal Specialist
description:
**Company Overview**
 Planview has one mission: to build the future of connected work, from ideas to impact.
   

  

 As the global leader in work and resource management, Planview helps organizations accelerate the achievement of what matters most, supporting our customers from need to speed, from passion to progress, and from overhead to optimization. We provide the industry’s most comprehensive solutions designed for strategic planning, portfolio and resource management, Lean and Agile delivery, product portfolio management, capability, and technology management (enterprise architecture), innovation management, and collaborative work and project management. Our connected platform of solutions underpins the business and digital transformations of more than 4,500 customers globally, including 59 of the Fortune 100.
   

  

 At Planview, our people connections drive our innovation and success. Our global team of 1400+ work remotely and across our offices including Austin, Vancouver, Hod Hasharon, Bangalore, Sydney, and Stockholm. We’re proud of our world-class, connected culture built on our shared values, that supports our teams to be successful from anywhere.
   

  

 Learn more about our portfolio at planview.com , and connect with us on LinkedIn, Instagram , and Twitter .
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 We’re looking for a Customer Renewal Specialist to join our team in EMEA. In this role, you will be responsible for managing a portfolio of assigned customer accounts and successfully executing the renewals process. The CRS works as part of the Planview account team is integral to in ensuring Planview’s customers are happy and retained for the long-term while hitting company targets.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Negotiate and execute customer renewals, across multiple product lines and regions.
* Ensure quarterly targets are hit or exceeded around price increases, multi-year agreements, timeliness, customer churn and retention.
* Review customer contracts for relevant terms and conditions.
* Maintain accurate data, reporting and forecasting on assigned renewals.
* Develop an understanding of the Planview licensing and pricing models, renewal guidelines and procedures.
* Position the Planview platform to customers for the most optimal experience, including new features and products.
* Ensure any renewal related issues and escalations are managed appropriately and resolved quickly, leveraging appropriate supporting resources from Planview as needed.
* Partner with Account team members to strategize on a successful renewal.
* Lead departmental projects as required.


**What You'll Bring**
* Bachelor degree or equivalent job experience
* Fluent in English and business fluency in either French or German.
* 3-5 years of experience in renewals or similar role
* Knowledge of Salesforce and Salesforce CPQ.
* Exceptional team player with the ability to facilitate and harness cross-team collaboration while working in a hybrid work environment.
* A self-starter and quick learner comfortable in a fast-paced environment where priorities change constantly.
* Strong numerical, presentation and communication skills.
* Enthusiastic, positive, personable, and flexible.
* Ability to prioritize, multi-task, and perform effectively under pressure.
* Excellent time management skills and attention to detail.


**Benefits At Planview**
 At Planview, you’ll join our global team and culture which reflects the vibrant communities in which our employees live and work. To support you at Planview, you will enjoy:
   

  

* Unplugged Days: 4 company-wide paid days off per year to recharge and relax.
* Generous PTO offerings (region dependent).
* Region specific competitive benefit plans to support you at any life stage including parental leave, retirement, medical plans, wellness support, and remote work support.
* Paid time to volunteer through Planview’s Force for Good Week.
* Employee Referral bonus program.
* Weekly office lunches for hybrid team members and social events.
* Flexible work hours/environment.


 Now is a great time to join our team. If you are looking for a place to grow your career, innovate with best-in-class solutions, and build the future of connected work, Planview is the right place for you!
   

  

**Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at Planview**
 As part of our efforts to build a workforce with diverse talent, we encourage applications from Indigenous, Black, and other racialized communities, 2SLGBTQIA+ communities, people with neurodivergence, immigrants, people with disabilities, and other equity deserving groups. In addition to building a diverse workforce, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible experience. Reasonable accommodations for the interview process can be requested by emailing recruitment@planview.com.

title: Digital Workplace Specialist (temporary)
description:
*Research shows that women and other under-represented groups within our industry hesitate to apply unless they tick most boxes of a role description. At H2 Green Steel, we are building an impact company with sustainability at its core. We need a diverse, inclusive, and authentic team to rally behind our purpose of de-carbonizing hard-to-abate industries, starting with steel.*
*So, i* 
*f you are equally passionate about our purpose yet concerned that your experience doesn* 
*’* 
*t* 
*perfectly* 
*align with the qualifications stated in the job advert, we strongly encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate, either for this role – or for another upcoming role in our* 
*rapidly* 
*growing* 
*business* 
*.*
**About us:**
 H2 Green Steel is on a mission to disrupt the global steel industry by producing green steel, with the end goal of bringing down CO2 emissions to zero. By using green hydrogen and fossil-free electricity instead of coal; water and heat will be our primary emissions. By 2030, our ambition is to produce 5 million tonnes of green steel annually in our fully integrated, digitalized, and sustainable plant in Boden, located in northern Sweden - currently in construction phase. But this is just the beginning – our expertise in green hydrogen will enable us to decarbonize other industries in addition to steel, and we look forward to what’s next in store for us.
   

  

 We are looking for talented, innovative, and purpose-driven people to join our rapidly growing and diverse team. Our employees get to learn everyday, implement the latest technology and test and put their ideas into practice. Together, we are building an impact company with sustainability at its core – for our people, customers, investors, society, and planet.
   

  

**Digital Workplace Specialist**
**Parental leave cover, up to 14 months**
 Are you ready to join a dynamic team at the forefront of the digital revolution? Do you thrive in a fast-paced, innovative environment where no two days are the same? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you!
   

  

 As a Digital Workplace Specialist, you will be at the heart of our digital transformation. Your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Vendor Management: Develop and maintain strong relationships with our technology vendors to ensure we have the best tools and services available.
* Modern IT Support: Provide top-notch IT support, leveraging the latest technologies to keep our team productive and our systems running smoothly. We have an exciting "0 IT Support tickets goal" for EOY 2024. You'll play a key role in ensuring those tickets are first solved but then analyzed and planned for automation.
* Project Management: Lead and manage innovative projects that will shape the future of our digital workplace, from basic support tasks to implementing our next big thing.
* Tool Administration: Oversee the administration of our digital tools and platforms, ensuring they are optimized for efficiency and user satisfaction. This includes hands-on configuration and troubleshooting of a variety of third-party SaaS applications like Zoom, Slack, and Miro.
* New Work Creation: Be a pioneer in identifying and developing new processes and technologies that will enhance our digital workplace.


**What We're Looking For:**
* Proven experience in a digital workplace or IT support role.
* Strong project management skills with a knack for multitasking and prioritizing.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* A proactive, solution-oriented mindset with a passion for innovation.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* Familiarity with the latest digital tools and platforms.
* An understanding of IT fundamentals and a capability for finding systematic issues and repetitive tasks.
* A strong "can do" attitude and a love for helping people.
* Comfort with uncertainty and the ability to thrive in a less structured environment.
* A collaborative spirit and a preference for teamwork over working alone.


**Why Join Us?**
* Innovative Environment: Be part of a company that's leading the way in digital transformation and green steel production.
* Career Growth: Opportunities to grow and develop your skills in a supportive and forward-thinking environment.
* Fun Team: Join a team that values collaboration, creativity, and having fun at work.
* Flexible Working: Enjoy the flexibility of remote work options and a healthy work-life balance.
* Exciting Projects: Work on cutting-edge projects that will challenge and inspire you.
* Impactful Work: Make a positive impact on society and our planet by contributing to the decarbonization of the steel industry and beyond.
* Be the First of the New: At H2 Green Steel, we're not just looking for an employee; we're looking for a trailblazer. If you're ready to be the first of the new and help us build the digital workplace of tomorrow, we want to hear from you!


**What We Can Offer You**
 If you are passionate about making actual change and having a positive impact on society and our planet, H2 Green Steel offers a unique opportunity to be part of a fun and professional team with high ambitions.
   

  

 You will get the opportunity to shape your future career together with a company focusing on creating a culture where everyone can thrive and feel a sense of belonging. In the end, we know that H2 Green Steel’s growth and success is dependent on our people and we can’t wait to shape the future of steelmaking and other industries together as a team.

title: Customer Success Manager - Swedish speaking 🇸🇪
description:
Let's build the future together!
 




 Teamtailor is a leading Employer Branding and Applicant Tracking Software (ATS) SaaS platform, used by over 9000 companies and 200,000 users worldwide 🌏.
 



 Working at Teamtailor means working at a young, international, and fast-paced tech company that offers an ideal workplace for those who want to have a tangible impact on the growth of an organization and are craving responsibilities. It also means having lots of fun 🥳.
 



 Building a diverse team with various backgrounds and expertise has been at the core of Teamtailor since its very beginning and is truly part of its strength today! There are no typical profiles, each and every team member shares our vision and wants to be part of its success
 *.* 



 Customer Success Manager 
 
 That's why we're expanding our Customer Success department and looking for a Customer Success Manager to join our team focusing on the North Europe area, who speaks Swedish and English (➕ If you can speak any other languages). Our goal is to create happy users by providing the most satisfying experience possible. We are on a mission to achieve this and are searching for individuals who are passionate about delivering a world-class experience to our customers and users 👊.
 


 Your key responsibilities will be to: 
 + Implement and onboard new customers
+ Help our customers use Teamtailor at its full potential, with everything from integrations in our marketplace, and best practices to training opportunities
+ Work as a strategical advisor & goal-oriented for our customers
+ Work proactively with renewals
+ Build strong relationships 🤝
+ Find new business opportunities with our existing portfolio customers, in the form of expansion sales, upselling/cross-selling 💰
+ Track customer's accounts to identify churn risk and work actively to prevent that risk
+ Collect and analyze customers' feedback and present it internally
+ Together develop and improve ways of working with customer satisfaction.


 As a Customer Success Manager at Teamtailor you will be offered:
 + Responsibility for your own customer base
+ Internal development opportunities
+ The opportunity to work with the market's best product
+ Fixed salary with commission benefits
+ A hybrid and flexible workspace
+ Be part of a great multicultural team
+ Annual company trip to a surprise destination
+ A work culture that encourages freedom with responsibility.


 Is this you?
 * Experience in SaaS, HR/Recruitment, or Customer Success is preferred 🥷
* Proven experience in project management
* Good communication and listening skills 🗣️
* Ability to collaborate effectively with customers and colleagues
* Strong adaptability to changes in a fast-paced environment 💨
* Negotiation skills for managing commercial aspects of the role
* Engaged, creative, and solution-oriented mindset
* Willingness to learn and explore new ideas 🧠🌪️
* Fluency in Swedish and English 🇸🇪 & 🇬🇧
* Bachelor's or master's degree is a plus
* Up for some post-work fun with your colleagues? Fantastic! We're all about themed after-hours hangouts! 🪩



 We value your personality and we believe you're passionate about your work, ambitious and work hard to reach your own goals!

title: BI Consultants & Data Engineers - Stockholm or Gothenburg
description:
Job Advertisement: Specialized BI Consultancy Partner in Sweden
   

  

 Location: Stockholm or Gothenburg, Sweden
   

  

 Position: Data Engineer or BI Consultant/Developer or Data Analyst
   

  

 If you work as part of an internal team today - are you ready to take the next step into the consultancy world? If you're already Consulting, have you found a lack of exciting projects recently and feeling like a fresh challenge could be the right move?
   

  

 If so, one of our client's in Sweden is seeking specialized expertise within Business Intelligence to join their energetic team!
   

  

 About the Company:
   

  

 A prominent business intelligence consulting company with a specialization in Qlik & Microsoft platforms and a strong focus on Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. They proudly partner with leading firms such as Planacy, Nodegraph, Write!, DataRobot, and MPM Process Mining to deliver comprehensive BI solutions.
   

  

 They empower businesses by transforming data into actionable insights, specializing in providing customized BI solutions that help our clients make informed decisions. The team is comprised of dedicated professionals who are passionate about leveraging data to drive success. Their clientele spans various industries, including manufacturing, retail, logistics, government, and finance, encompassing both large international groups and smaller local enterprises.
   

  

 Role Overview:
   

  

 They are seeking talented and motivated BI Professionals to join their dynamic team with a strong emphasis on finding a skilled Data Engineer plus other opportunities for full-stack BI Consultants, BI Developers and Data Analysts!
   

  

 The ideal professionals will have strong backgrounds in data engineering, BI solutions & reporting, a passion for data-driven decision-making, and experience in building and maintaining scalable data pipelines. You will collaborate closely with our purely BI focused team made up of other data analysts, data scientists, data engineers and clients to ensure seamless data integration and optimal data flow.
   

  

 Our roles, especially for Data Engineers, encompass a broad range of tasks from backend data extraction and transformation, data modeling, and data visualization to direct interaction with end-users and stakeholders for requirements analysis. Their consultants often manage multiple customer relationships and assignments in parallel, providing a diverse and dynamic work environment. While some assignments are full-time, many allow flexibility, enabling our consultants to work from our offices, client sites, or remotely.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* Design, build, and maintain scalable and efficient data pipelines
* Develop and implement ETL processes to transform and load data from various sources
* Collaborate with data analysts and data scientists to understand data requirements and ensure data quality
* Optimize data infrastructure and architecture for performance and scalability
* Monitor and troubleshoot data pipeline issues to ensure data accuracy and availability
* Work with cloud-based data storage and processing solutions (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
* Implement data security and compliance best practices


 Beneficial Experience:
   

  

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
* Proven experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role
* Proficiency in SQL and experience with relational databases
* Strong programming skills in Python, Java, or Scala
* Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Kafka)
* Familiarity with cloud-based data solutions (e.g., AWS Redshift, Google BigQuery)
* Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
* Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and best practices
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
* Strong communication skills and ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
* Certification in cloud platforms (e.g., AWS Certified Data Analytics, Google Cloud Professional Data Engineer)
* Knowledge of machine learning concepts and frameworks


 What We Offer:
   

  

* Competitive salary and benefits package
* Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and innovative projects
* Collaborative and inclusive work environment
* Professional development and growth opportunities
* Flexible working hours and remote work options
* Fantastic office spaces - depending on your location in Stockholm or Gothenburg


 How to Apply:
   

  

 If you are passionate about data and eager to make an impact, we would love to hear from you! Please submit your resume detailing your experience and we'll be in touch!

title: IT Application Specialist till Linde Gas
description:
Linde Gas söker en stark problemlösare med passion för teknik som vill fortsätta utvecklas i rollen som Applikationsspecialist. Här en del av ett starkt team med hög kompetens och engagemang. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Linde Gas
 



  

**Plats :**
 Solna, Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Som Applikationsspecialist på Linde Gas kommer du att ansvara för två plattformar, Accura och Linx. Accura är en egenutvecklad applikation som används av Lindes kunder, såsom sjukhus, för att hantera lager och beställningar. Linx är en handdatorapplikation för Lindes återförsäljare i syfte att hålla koll på lagerhållning. Du kommer att arbeta nära applikationsägare och externa partners för att underhålla och förbättra dessa system, samt säkerställa att de fungerar optimalt.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Möjligheten att arbeta på ett globalt företag med stora utvecklingsmöjligheter
  
* Stöd och utbildning för att utveckla din tekniska kompetens
  
* En dynamisk arbetsmiljö med engagerade och kunniga kollegor
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Utföra underhåll, uppdatering och utveckling på plattformarna
  
* Ge kvalificerad systemteknisk support i samarbete med applikationsögare
  
* Arbeta direkt med applikationsägare för att förstå och hjälpa till att definiera nya applikationskrav
  
* Säkerställa lämplig kunskapsöverföring för applikationer som utvecklats med externa partners för att möjliggöra internt stöd
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har en relevant utbildningsbakgrund, troligtvis inom IT
  
* Har erfarenhet av applikationsutveckling, och gärna SAP-relaterad
  
* Grundläggande kunskaper i Java och Azure
  
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
  
* Har en bred teknisk bakgrund
  
* Har erfarenhet av att hantera leverantörer
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Målmedveten
  
* Ordningsam
  
* Stabil
  
* Ansvarstagande
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Linde Gas**

 Linde är ett ledande globalt företag inom industrigaser och teknik. Linde lever efter sin mission att göra vår värld mer produktiv varje dag genom att tillhandahålla högkvalitativa lösningar, teknologier och tjänster som gör deras kunder mer framgångsrika och hjälper till att upprätthålla, avkarbonisera och skydda vår planet.
 


  


 Lindes industrigaser och teknologier används i otaliga applikationer, inklusive produktion av ren väte som är kritisk för energiomställningen, livräddande medicinsk syrgas och högrenade specialgaser för elektronik, bland annat. I över 50 år har Linde varit en global ledare inom väte och utnyttjar sin ingenjörskompetens, tillsammans med en betydande tillgångsbas och expertis, för att göra renare energi till verklighet världen över.
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Linde Gas**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Mikaela Hofstedt eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stv3@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105985

title: Security Specialist
description:
**Welcome to Eficode!**
 We are building the future of software development - specializing in Cloud, DevOps, Agile, and Development. We help our customers transform into software-driven organizations, aiming to change the world by sharing our knowledge. Our employees value: opportunities for growth, psychological safety and culture - we appreciate our laid-back and autonomous, but supportive atmosphere.
   

  

**We’re on the lookout for a Security Specialist or Engineer**
 Eficode is looking for an experienced Security Specialist or Engineer for our Security Team. The role is primarily focused on managed services security but will share duties with the wider security organization at Eficode.
   

  

**In This Role, You Will**
* Collaborate with managed services technical teams to support and guide security-related processes and tasks.
* Collaborate with customers on security-related topics.
* Take part in security awareness programs, developing and refining security processes, and incident management protocols.
* Conduct thorough security reporting and drive continuous improvement in our security practices within the business area.
* Integrate IT security controls into business area operations.
* Take the lead in monitoring and responding to security incidents in our environments, ensuring swift detection and response.
* Coordinate response and recovery activities during incidents as part of our incident management efforts, ensuring continuous business operations.
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders to ensure optimal operation of our ISO 27001-certified security system.
* Mentor and train your colleagues on the industry's best practices.
* Develop our security practices and processes to help us scale further securely-
* Play a pivotal role in sustaining and enhancing the security posture of our systems and processes.
* Engage in proactive learning and development to stay ahead of security trends and technologies.
* Provide coaching and training to colleagues, fostering a culture of security awareness and competence.


**Who are we looking for?**
**Our Ideal Security Specialist Or Engineer Is Someone Who**
* Has a minimum 5 years relevant experience with a proven track record of success in IT security operations.
* Has experience in Cloud Security, with a focus on securing cloud-based infrastructure and services.
* Holds an information technology or security degree (bachelor's or higher).
* Is skilled in cybersecurity tools and software applications.
* Demonstrates analytical thinking capabilities and a problem-solving mindset.
* Can communicate effectively in English.
* Shares our continuous learning and knowledge-sharing culture.
* Has experience with security process management and incident response.
* Conducts training sessions and presentations.
* Collaborates effectively with different teams, technical and non-technical.


**It’s Advantageous If You Have**
* Previous experience in managed services environments.
* Experience with security certifications and frameworks such as CIS, NIST, ISO/IEC 27000 Series.


**Why Choose Eficode?**
* You’ll have the opportunity to contribute and participate in an exciting international growth story.
* Eficode is a hub of bright minds working on groundbreaking projects.
* We provide an environment that respects experience, nurtures talent, and encourages growth.
* Open collaboration and clear communication are the cornerstones of our culture.
* With our commitment to personal development, your growth never stops.
* Flexible Work: Tailor your work environment and schedule to fit your life best, with remote work options available.
* On top of your compensation, we offer fringe benefits that depend on your location.
* Possibility to explore life in another country through our international presence.


**Join Us!**
 If you want to significantly impact a growing international organization, Eficode is where you belong.
   

  

 This is a full-time, hybrid remote role available in
 **Finland, Sweden, Poland, or the UK** 
 (please note that we hope you are already located in one of these countries).
   

  

 If this opportunity sparks your interest, please apply
 **by 21st of July 2024** 
 , we would love to hear from you!
   

  

*At Eficode we are committed to offering an inclusive recruitment process and equal opportunities for all applicants.*
*We are dedicated to creating a work environment that embraces diversity, inclusion, and respect for all employees. We believe that our differences make us better. We recognize that by having diverse perspectives, skills, ages, genders, backgrounds and cultures we will better drive our customers forward and innovate in our field.*
*To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from sharing unnecessary personal information and your picture on your job application.*
*Eficode, better made possible.*

title: Senior Technology Risk Manager
description:
**Job ID: 24925** 






  

  



**Would you like to help the bank manage Technology risks? We are now looking for a** 
**Technology** 
**Risk Manager to coordinate and drive risk and compliance activities within the Domain.**
 At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast – and we want to be one step ahead of the curve. That’s why we’re deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers. We’re creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together – and we need your ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll be in good company with a chance to make your mark on something bigger. 
 





  

  



**About this opportunity** 






  
 








 Welcome to the Technology Risk Management unit. Technology Risk Management’s ambition is to take on complex tasks and bring them from idea phase to realisation. In parallel, we increase risk awareness and continuously build structures and procedures that give Nordea Technology management excellent qualitative support.
 













  
 













 As the Risk Manager supporting Technology in Nordea, you will work in the 1st Line of Defence and help to drive initiatives to increase Technology risk awareness and ensure prudent risk and control management.
 








  

  



**What you’ll be doing:** 





* Partner with senior level management and stakeholders throughout the cybersecurity risk management value chain
* Provide advisory to monitor and report Nordea’s cybersecurity risk portfolio and associated controls
* Lead and participate in risk assessments, process control and mitigation, support the cybersecurity division in the end-to-end risk process overview
* Roll-out services according to frameworks and guidelines in the bank, and support in enhancing risk and compliance culture
* Secure necessary input, anchoring and optimising the decision-making process, with a holistic approach, and that tasks are adequately managed
* Develop quality analysis, communication material, reports and decision-making proposals to executive management, stakeholders and to risk governance forums



  
 





 You’ll join a Nordic and Polish team, passionate about providing risk and compliance services through business and technological insight. The role is based in Stockholm.
 





  
 





 Your work life balance is important to us, and you will have the opportunity to work remotely a couple of days a week. 
 





  

  



**Who you are**




 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  
   

  

**To succeed in this role, we believe that you:** 





* Love learning and trying new things and you’re excited about bringing your ideas to the table.
* Have strong interest in being coordinator for activities and play a central role in driving change as well as support the creation of a great customer experience


* Like collaboration with multidisciplinary teams, and find it interesting and rewarding to work in a cross-border Nordics & Poland organisation
* Have stakeholder management skills and communication skills to provide partnership and insight with divisional teams, while aligning with the 2nd LoD



  

  



**Your experience and background:** 





* Three to four years of experience working in Technology risk or audit management, preferably in a regulated or big organisation
* Formal certifications in CISSP, CISA, CISM, CCSP or similar will be considered, as well as knowledge or practical experience with ISO 27001/2
* Understanding of general cybersecurity concepts like EDR, Patch and Vulnerability Management, Threat detection, Identity and Access Management, Data Leakage Protection, Encryption and Key Management and Cloud Security
* Fluency in written and spoken English



  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than
 



 20/07/2024
 



 . 
 





  

  



 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  
 





 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.
 





  
 





 For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.

title: Application Security Consultant
description:
**About Accenture Security**
**Be yourself,** 
**Influence the future**
**Are you ready to take your skills to a new level?**
 At Accenture, working days are never the same and that´s why we have fun here! This is a great opportunity to build a rewarding career at
 **Accenture Security.** 
 With us, you get to work in a relaxed bold team, with talented and supportive colleagues. We support your individual skills in an engaging work community where everyone is allowed to be themselves. We believe in inclusion and diversity and supporting the whole person. At Accenture, you get to work on customer projects at the world´s leading companies. Accenture is a leading global consulting company that provides services in strategy, consulting, digitalization, technology, and outsourcing. With experience, specialized expertise, global resources, and extensive industry expertise. Accenture works at the business and technology level to help customers increase their performance and develop sustainable value for their stakeholders. With over 700.000 employees and customers in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation for a simplified everyday life. We are currently looking to recruit
 **Application Security Experts** 
 to be a part of our global security community
 **.**
**What We Are Looking For**
- Bachelor's or Master’s degree in IT/Information Technology/Computer Science.

- Minimum 4 years of work experience within the cyber security field.

- Deep experience with secure software development, application security and/or DevSecOps.

- Experience with cloud solutions such as Azure, AWS, GCP and/or infrastructure.

- Experience in engaging directly with technical representatives from clients during system development.

- Familiarity with standards, regulations, and frameworks such as: OWASP, OIDC, OAuth, XACML, or GDPR.

- Proficient in both spoken and written Swedish (or other Scandinavian languages), as well as English.

**Nice to have**
- Developer skills in areas such as Java, Spring framework, NodeJS, microservices architecture, Docker, Kubernetes, microservices, and more.

- Hands-on experience from security tools like Veracode, Splunk, Snyk, or similar.

- Relevant certifications: CCSK, CISSP, CSSLP, or similar.

- Current or former Norwegian security personnel clearance.

- Experience in leading projects and/or technical teams.

**Life at Accenture**
 Throughout your time at Accenture, we do not only offer our people the training they need but also expect them to take the time to learn and grow in a culture of continuous improvement. As you progress through your career in the path you choose, you will move more and more towards a leadership role in the truest sense of the word. Leaders lead by respect, knowledge and by helping those more junior than themselves. You will also be assigned a career counselor over time.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We offer and inclusive and inspiring work environment with access to our global network and ample training opportunities. You will be able to develop your skills within security and grow both personally and professionally. Our projects are built on cooperation and teamwork, and you will find yourself teaming with other talented, passionate and dedicated consultants, all working towards a shared goal. Some of our benefits:
   

  

  

- Accenture Sweden employees are entitled to minimum of 5 weeks of vacation every year.

- All employees in Accenture have a pension saving plan.

- Health Insurance

- Health Allowance at 5000 SEK per year

- Within Accenture, you are encouraged to do trainings related to your profession, to develop your skills.

 We also offer:
   

  

  

- A unique opportunity to use technical knowledge to contribute to innovation and socially changing projects – Accenture has a large customer portfolio across all industries. Which brings with it many exciting opportunities!

- Great professional challenges and a unique opportunity to apply your expertise and work on projects that matter to you and the society.

- Everyone in Accenture has a dedicated internal career counsellor and sparring partner with whom you can discuss personal development in confidence.

- Good bonus schemes, competitive salary, minimum 5 weeks of vacation, health insurance, pension schemes, share savings program and parental leave covered beyond NAV’s terms and conditions up to 12G.

- A packed social calendar for those interested. We have regular beer, board game night, watch handball match, play volleyball, go surfing, play chess and go cross-country skiing, etc

**We look forward to learning more about you!** 
 Apply online, attach your CV and letter of application in English. If you have any questions, please contact responsible recruiter: karl.kego@accenture.com

title: Customer Success Manager - Danish speaking 🇩🇰
description:
Let's build the future together!
 




 Teamtailor is a leading Employer Branding and Applicant Tracking Software (ATS) SaaS platform, used by over 9000 companies and 200,000 users worldwide 🌏.
 



 Working at Teamtailor means working at a young, international, and fast-paced tech company that offers an ideal workplace for those who want to have a tangible impact on the growth of an organization and are craving responsibilities. It also means having lots of fun 🥳.
 



 Building a diverse team with various backgrounds and expertise has been at the core of Teamtailor since its very beginning and is truly part of its strength today! There are no typical profiles, each and every team member shares our vision and wants to be part of its success
 *.* 



 Customer Success Manager 
 
 That's why we're expanding our Customer Success department and looking for a Customer Success Manager to join our team focusing on the North Europe area, who speaks Danish and English (➕ If you can speak any other languages). Our goal is to create happy users by providing the most satisfying experience possible. We are on a mission to achieve this and are searching for individuals who are passionate about delivering a world-class experience to our customers and users 👊.
 


 Your key responsibilities will be to: 
 + Implement and onboard new customers
+ Help our customers use Teamtailor at its full potential, with everything from integrations in our marketplace, and best practices to training opportunities
+ Work as a strategical advisor & goal-oriented for our customers
+ Work proactively with renewals
+ Build strong relationships 🤝
+ Find new business opportunities with our existing portfolio customers, in the form of expansion sales, upselling/cross-selling 💰
+ Track customer's accounts to identify churn risk and work actively to prevent that risk
+ Collect and analyze customers' feedback and present it internally
+ Together develop and improve ways of working with customer satisfaction.


 As a Customer Success Manager at Teamtailor you will be offered:
 + Responsibility for your own customer base
+ Internal development opportunities
+ The opportunity to work with the market's best product
+ Fixed salary with commission benefits
+ A hybrid and flexible workspace
+ Be part of a great multicultural team
+ Annual company trip to a surprise destination
+ A work culture that encourages freedom with responsibility.


 Is this you?
 * Experience in SaaS, HR/Recruitment, or Customer Success is preferred 🥷
* Proven experience in project management
* Good communication and listening skills 🗣️
* Ability to collaborate effectively with customers and colleagues
* Strong adaptability to changes in a fast-paced environment 💨
* Negotiation skills for managing commercial aspects of the role
* Engaged, creative, and solution-oriented mindset
* Willingness to learn and explore new ideas 🧠🌪️
* Fluency in Danish and English 🇩🇰 & 🇬🇧
* Bachelor's or master's degree is a plus
* Up for some post-work fun with your colleagues? Fantastic! We're all about themed after-hours hangouts! 🪩



 We value your personality and we believe you're passionate about your work, ambitious and work hard to reach your own goals!

title: ServiceNow Platform Architect
description:
Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all of these services. With our thought leadership and culture of innovation, we apply industry expertise, diverse skill sets and next-generation technology to each business challenge.
   

  

 Are you ready to take your expertise to the next level? Take this opportunity to develop your skills and build an extraordinary career, join our pioneering team at Accenture, where we've recently achieved remarkable milestones as
 **ServiceNow's #1 and Most Comprehensive Partner** 
 .
   

  

  

- In 2023, we were honored with prestigious awards including Global, EMEA, Americas & APJ Partner of the Year, solidifying our position as a leader in the industry.

- As the sole Global Elite Partner awarded customer and employee workflow badges, we uphold the highest standards set by ServiceNow's partner program.

 We are looking at significantly growing our
 **ServiceNow Business Group** 
 in the Nordics. Join our team as a
 **ServiceNow Architect** 
 and help our clients to solve their most critical business challenges, improve performance and gain a competitive edge!
   

  

**Responsibilities**
- Effectively managing key stakeholders both internally and externally to the organisation

- Analyse and translate business and technical requirements into an architectural blueprint to achieve complex business objectives.

- Engage with the customer’s Enterprise Architects to position ServiceNow as the standard digital transformation platform integrated with the customer’s core applications.

- Establish and manage a technical governance.

- Ensure the instance health by working with the engagement team to reduce technical debt and align to ServiceNow leading practices.

- Facilitating workshops or meetings to gather requirements, presenting, and validating solutions and test the interpretation of the client’s needs

- Demonstrate solid insights in designing ServiceNow’s capabilities

- Demonstrate strong experience working with ServiceNow platform (e.g., ITSM, ITOM, ITAM, GRC, SecOps, HR)

- Produce a detailed functional design document to match customer requirements

- Act as a mentor to support less experienced colleagues

- Serves as an active contributor of leading practices, standards, and thought leadership related to the ServiceNow platform.

- Contribute to the development of opportunities and provide input to grow our business

**Preferred Qualifications**
- Industry and project experience of 5+ years with ServiceNow

- Good understanding of several ServiceNow capabilities

- Thorough knowledge on workflows, tables, script, flow designer and integration hub.

- Excellent knowledge on Enterprise Security and Architecture, middleware and discovery technologies, database design schemas and data modelling

- Strong analytical skills, communication, and presentation skills

- Ability to manage development teams, customers and stakeholder expectations

- Have the drive and dedication to pursue learning opportunities and continuously share your knowledge with peers

- Experience in working according to agile, scrum or SAFe principles

- Knowledge and experience of Infrastructure Operations, migration as well as ServiceNow Integration with Third party system.

- Prior experience of working with international teams (this role is in the Nordics)

- Fluent in English (spoken and written)

- University degree in Computer Science or equivalent

- Experience working on RFPs and presales support

- Hold certifications in one or more of the areas: CSA, CAD, ITSM, ITOM, HAM, ITAM or HR.

**As a person you have**
- Valid Work permit for Sweden

- Strong interpersonal skills with a collaboration mindset both within and outside the immediate team

- Passionate about working in a fast-paced global environment

- Value collaborating within culturally diverse teams

- Creative and solution oriented.

- Eager to embrace new challenges and drive them to completion

**Why Join Accenture?**
 Join Accenture and become part of a passionate team committed to technology, innovation, and personal growth.
   

  

  

- Unlock significant career development opportunities with access to training, certifications, and a clear path for advancement with free ServiceNow training, we have an all-inclusive agreement with ServiceNow

- Embark on your journey to becoming a certified CTA or CMA with us! Join our exclusive ServiceNow certified CTA program.

- Working with large and complex solutions, our clients are some of the largest in the Nordic

- Be on forefront in technology working with the latest cutting-edge innovations like Generative AI

- Join the largest community of skilled ServiceNow professionals within the ServiceNow ecosystem.

 Pleasenote that due to the summer season, our hiring process may be slower than usual. We apologize for any delay in responding to your applications. Rest assured, we are committed to reviewing each application thoroughly. We appreciate your patience during this time.

title: Senior Engineer/Tech Lead in Unit Master Data Production – Solna/Hybrid
description:
The IT department at PostNord consists of a dedicated team responsible for driving innovation and delivering high-quality software solutions. Our mission is to support the organization's strategic goals by developing scalable and efficient systems. We foster a collaborative and inclusive culture where every team member's contribution is valued.
   

  

**Job Duties**
 As the Senior Engineer/Tech Lead for the Geographical Information Master, you will be coding and play a pivotal role in leading the Tech development and enhancement of PostNord Geographical Master Data. With the most part of PostNord systems consuming GIM Master data and Nordic Countries using the GIM UI your responsibilities will include making sure that the application is using the right software and that it is updated accordingly. You will collaborate closely with PO, Team, Senior Master Data Architect and Enterprise Master Data Architect making sure GIM system is developed and maintained correctly.
   

  

**We are looking for you who have** 
**Experience: (Need-to-have)**
* Experience in managing application with Event driven architecture.
* Proven experience (3+ years) as an Engineer or similar role like Tech Lead.
* Experience in building microservices
* Understanding of container orchestration platforms and experience deploying production software
* Solid understanding of software architecture, design patterns, and best practices
* Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think critically
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Knowledge and experience working with GO
* Experience with Agile methodologies and DevOps practices


**Meritorious experience: (Nice-to-have)**
* Experience in working with logistics industry specifically around Master Data and Geographical Data.
* Strong understanding of PostNord Geographical Data, particularly within the Nordic region.


**We believe you are a person that is:**
* Thorough, analytical, and quick to learn new systems
* Inclusive, structured, and responsible in your working style
* Able to handle stressful situations and prioritize tasks independently
* Communicative and easy to collaborate with, building and nurturing long-term relationships


**We offer you**
**Benefits**
 We offer a variety of work in an international environment with constantly new challenges and quick decisions. Here you have opportunities to develop creative solutions and work in a prestige-free group where we jointly help to reach our goals. PostNord is one of Sweden's largest workplaces and we offer safe employment conditions and benefits. In addition to the benefits mentioned above, we offer:
   

  

* Hybrid workplace with a Nordic and dynamic environment.  Watch the video about our office.
* Great development opportunities
* Great insurance and occupational pension terms
* Wellness allowance & opportunity to train at Arken's gym and indoor swimming pool
* Employee benefits through  PostNord Plus - PostNord´s own personnel foundation


**We make everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. We are in a constant transformation and work consistently to develop both our offer and our employees, all to achieve our vision of being The favorite carrier of the Nordics. We are PostNord - a fantastic company to work and grow with. Read more at postnord.com
   

  

**Apply**
 We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

 If you have any questions or concerns, please contact manager Robin Lindfors on robin.lindfors1@postnord.com
   

  

 Don't wait to submit your application as we go through the applications on an ongoing basis.
   

  

 For union representatives, visit:  Facklig kontakt | PostNord
   

  

 We are looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Uppskilla dig i systemintegration!
description:
Gillar du att jobba med API:er och integrationer, och känner dig redo att utmanas i projekt som behöver expertis inom de senaste plattforms- och integrationslösningarna? Vi erbjuder nu möjligheten till upskilling genom en strukturerad onboarding och skräddarsytt utbildningsupplägg.
   

  

**Vad gör vi?**
 Hos oss får du möjligheten att jobba teamorienterat i meningsfulla och kundnära projekt. Vårt Cloud & Connectivity-team ansvarar för att designa, utveckla och implementera integrations- och plattformslösningar, ofta i en skalbar miljö. Vi har en cloud-first strategi och är ett av de ledande företagen i Norden gällande offentliga molnlösningar och -tjänster – i samarbete med viktiga aktörer som Azure, GCP och AWS.
   

  

 Våra integrationskonsulter är experter på att smidigt koppla samman affärskritiska system, migrera integrationer mellan plattformar, samt designa API:er och uppbyggnaden av dessa. Vi strävar till att vara tech-agnostiska med fokus på hållbara och långsiktiga lösningar som stöttar kundens verksamhet och väg framåt.
   

  

**Vårt upplägg**
 Vårt skräddarsydda upplägg hjälper dig växa som integrationskonsult och förbättra dina kunskaper inom exempelvis iPaaS, API design & utveckling, kravställning, och testning av lösningar. Målet är att växa dina färdigheter inom systemintegration för att ta del av ett större utbud av utmanande och spännande projekt där du får agera expert kring de bäst lämpade lösningarna.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder en strukturerad onboarding följt av ett anpassat upplägg där du, parallellt med kunduppdrag, har chansen att avsätta upp till 10% av din arbetstid specifikt på kompetensutveckling och certifiering inom de integrationstekniker som du önskar, såsom exempelvis Boomi och Azure. Du får därmed möjlighet att påverka din utveckling och inriktning på Solita från dag 1.
   

  

 Som en lärande organisation erbjuder vi även möjligheter att växa genom;
   

  

* Mentorskap och intern coaching
* Kompetensnätverk och föreläsningar
* Externa och interna lärplattformar
* Roll-specifika learning paths, såsom vår Architect path
* Varierande och roterande kunduppdrag


**Vem är du?**
 Vi ser helst att du jobbat med integrationsutveckling eller -arkitektur i några år, exempelvis med tekniker såsom BizTalk, Snaplogic, TIBCO, IBM Websphere eller Oracle, och vill nu fördjupa dig inom nya tekniker och plattformslösningar.
   

  

 Vi hoppas att du har med dig;
   

  

* God erfarenhet av integrationslösningar oberoende av plattform;
* Erfarenhet inom ett eller flera av följande språk: Java, C#, Python, Golang, Node;
* God kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska.


**Vad får du?**
 Som anställd hos oss kan du vänta dig;
   

  

* Projekt som skapar avtryck, både hos kunder och i samhället;
* Variation; i branscher, i team, i nya teknologier och system, i angreppsätt;
* Flexibilitet och autonomi för att utforma ditt arbete – läs mer från vår blogg;
* En trygg och human arbetsmiljö för att främja innovation, motivation och välmående;
* Konkurrenskraftig, fast lön i kombination med ett komplett förmånspaket bestående av exempelvis 30 semesterdagar, maxat friskvårdsbidrag, bike leasing, intern coach och ett omfattande försäkringsskydd samt pensionsavsättningar även under din föräldraledighet.


*Lyssna inte bara på oss – läs mer på* 
*Glassdoor* 
*!*
**Låter det spännande?**
 Berätta om dina färdigheter och önskemål, så tar vi tillsammans reda på om det kan bli en bra match. Detta är en löpande rekrytering.
   

  

 Om du har frågor får du gärna nå ut till oss på LinkedIn eller via mail: Head of People & Culture Patrik Rafstedt (patrik.rafstedt(at)solita.se); People Lead Sam Odeh (sam.odeh(at)solita.se) eller Talent Acquisition Specialist Kajsa Törnroos (kajsa.tornroos(at)solita.se).
   

  

 Vi rekryterar i
 **Stockholm, Göteborg** 
 och
 **Malmö!**
